w:r.w:t: Checklist at the end of your paper. It is mandatory.
See the following page for an example.
Add two empty lines after the abstract.
All headings should be lower case (except for first word and proper nouns), flush left, and bold.
When you quote directly, include the
If the author’s name appears in your sentence, only include the year in parentheses.
, include both names with an ampersand.
, use the first author’s name followed by et al.
together, list them alphabetically and separate with semicolons.
as authors, spell out the name the first time, then abbreviate if well known.
in the order they appear in the text:
goes in italics, in title case, placed
below if needed to explain abbreviations or details.
refer to each table or figure in the text
eaders should understand them without reading the text.
(same as the main text) and avoid vertical lines in tables.
If reproduced or adapted from another source, include
and full citation in the reference list.
Footnotes should be used sparingly. If you do require a footnote, indicate footnotes with a number
in the text. Place the footnotes at the bottom of the page on which they appear.
Start on a new page titled References (
List entries alphabetically by the first author’s last name.
Use hanging indents (first line flush left, rest indented).
Smith, J. A., & Brown, L. M. (2021).
Include DOIs or URLs when available, written as links (no “Retrieved from”).
followed by the AI involvement checklist.
Papers not including the checklist will be desk rejected
You will give a score for each of the categories that define the role of AI in each part of the scientific process. The scores are as follows:
of the research, with AI being of minimal involvement.
The research was a collaboration between humans and AI models, but
The research task was a collaboration between humans and AI models, but
of the research. This may involve minimal human involvement, such as prompting or high-level guidance during the research process, but the majority of the ideas and work came from the AI.
